column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Fill a Mutual Fund Form
#Text=In order to invest in a mutual fund , you will need to give the investment firm a variety of information .
#Text=This information will include your personal information , your payment information , and what mutual funds you want to invest in .
#Text=After you provide all of this information , the investment can be completed by the broker .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Providing Your Basic Information
#Text=Fill in your name .
#Text=At the top of any mutual fund form you will be asked to give your name .
#Text=Fill in your full legal name , so that the investment will be correctly assigned to you .
#Text=Some forms will have you put your last name first , while others will have you put in your first name first .
#Text=Read the directions on the form and follow them while filling in information .
#Text=Add additional investors .
#Text=If you would like to have another person on your mutual fund account , you can add them at this point .
#Text=However , having someone else 's name on the account makes them an equal partner in the investment , so do this cautiously .
#Text=If you would like to set up an account for your child or grandchild , you can do this by adding their name to your account .
#Text=This has to be done in a specific part of the form that is usually designated for " investments on behalf of a minor . "

column1: #Text=They cannot have their own account if they are under 18 years old .
#Text=However , by having their name on your account , they will be the beneficiary .
#Text=Provide your date of birth .
#Text=In order to verify your identify , the form will ask for your date of birth .
#Text=Your date of birth will also help the investment firm ensure that you are old enough to invest in a mutual fund .
#Text=It is most likely that you will be asked to input your date of birth with only numeric digits .
#Text=In the US , this is done by putting the month , day , and then year .
#Text=In other countries , the day will be put in before the month .
#Text=Fill in your contact information .
#Text=In order for the investment company to contact you about your account , you should give them both a phone number and email address where you can be reached .
#Text=In most cases , the email address will be used for correspondence .
#Text=Legally , the mutual fund is required to keep you updated on changes on a regular basis .
#Text=These updates will typically be emailed to you .
#Text=Give your address .
#Text=You will also need to provide a street address in order to open a mutual fund account .
#Text=This helps the investment company and the government ensure that you are allowed to open an account and it gives them somewhere to send correspondence about the account .
#Text=When opening a mutual fund you are likely to get updates about your investment mailed to you .
#Text=You will also get tax information sent to you by the government .
#Text=Provide additional demographic information .
#Text=Depending on the company you are using to open your mutual fund account , they may ask you a variety of other questions .
#Text=These are typically just demographic questions that they use in house for statistics or promotional campaigns .
#Text=For example , the form may ask your gender or sex .
#Text=This is typically used so that the company knows the breakdown of their investors and so that they can use the correct pronouns with you when you interact with them .
#Text=Giving Your Financial Information
#Text=Mark how you will be paying for your investment .
#Text=In order to pay for your investment , you can typically link to a bank account or pay with a check .
#Text=There should be a box to check that signals which form of payment you will use .
#Text=Depending on the amount you are investing and what your investment company prefers , you can use a personal check , money order , or certified check to pay for your investment .
#Text=Specify how much money you will be putting into the mutual fund .
#Text=The form should include a summary of how much money you are investing in the mutual fund .
#Text=The money may be put into a variety of funds , but the total amount you are paying should be specified .
#Text=Give your bank account information .
#Text=If you are paying with a transfer directly from a bank account , you will need to provide the name of your banking institution and the routing number of that bank .
#Text=You will also need to provide your specific account number so that funds can be requested from the account .
#Text=Specifying the Investment Fund
#Text=Identify exactly what mutual funds you are investing in .
#Text=In order to ensure that you are investing your money exactly where you want to be , the name of the fund should be specified .
#Text=If you are putting money into to several different funds , they should all be listed .
#Text=There are 4 main types of mutual funds : money market funds , bond funds , stock funds , and target date funds .
#Text=The type of fund you are investing in should be indicated on the form .
#Text=If you are unsure of the name of specific mutual funds , allow your investment advisor to write them down .
#Text=The name of the fund may vary slightly depending on if you are investing thorough an independent broker or a broker for the fund .
#Text=Specify how many shares you are buying .
#Text=For each mutual fund listed , you will need to write down how much money you are investing and how many shares that buys you .
#Text=If you are only investing in one mutual fund , the amount of money you list will be the same as your total payment .
#Text=The price of shares in a mutual fund are set daily .
#Text=This price is called the NAV ( net asset value ) .
#Text=This is how the price will be referred to on your form .
#Text=Verify your investment .
#Text=After you have filled in all the required information , you will be asked to verify the investment with your name and signature .
#Text=This will allow the investment firm to transfer of funds into your new mutual fund account .
